113.content: What's your adventure going to be?

choices: Wisdom San reveals the origins of the super duper sumo dogs.
A group of enemies invade the sumo stable.
1133.content:
It all started one day in Sterliteville California as you happen to be a 29 year old American gentleman and scholar who found a note that was sent to your house's address.

"To the most honorable recipient of this note, meet us at our sumo stable that's located in downtown Sterliteville for we're definitely looking forward to seeing you in person." The note read as you were asked to meet at a sumo stable in town.

"I didn't know Sterliteville had a sumo stable, but I may as well go over to this sumo stable that's in downtown Sterliteville." You said.

After you walked out of your house and through downtown Sterliteville you found the town's sumo stable as you couldn't help but look at the sumo stable itself, as it looked like any other ordinary well kept clean sumo stable.

"Now it's time to take one small step for man, one giant leap for yours truly." You said as opened the doors to the sumo stable as you walked in.

"This is definitely a nice place they have here." You muttered to yourself.

"It definitely is a nice place my son. Now what brings you to my sumo stable?" A kindly bearded male animated anthropomorphic Shiba Inu with a Yiddish accent said as he walked over to you.

"There was a note that I found at my house as I was asked to meet at a sumo stable here in town. And who are you anyway?" You said you addressed the instructor of the sumo stable.

"Allow me to introduce myself my name is Wisdom San as I'm the instructor of this sumo stable and also allow me the honor of introducing to you my students and the town's heroes the super duper sumo dogs." Wisdom San said as three male animated anthropomorphic Welsh Pembroke Corgis and a female Welsh Pembroke Corgi walked to over where you and Wisdom San were standing.

"First up is the unofficial leader of the super duper sumo dogs Juan Corgi who fights for truth as he also loves to eat and cook." Wisdom San said as he introduced the team's unofficial leader and most sensible member as his special move is the sumo squeeze whereas he grabs an enemy from behind and gives his enemy a powerful bear hug.

"Next up is Carlos Corgi as he fights for honor and has a zen like attitude to life as he's also precognitive as well, as his special move is known as the most honorable thunder ball whereas he rolls into that of a bowling ball and quickly launches himself at his enemy." Wisdom San said as he introduced the team's second of four members.

"This is Waffles Corgi who speaks like a surfer as he's enthusiastic and mature as he fights for peace, as his special move is known as the butt bomb as he jumps into the air and lands on an enemy butt first as he squashes his enemy with ease." Wisdom San said as he introduced the team's third member.

"And finally we have Chloe Corgi the youngest sibling and member of the group who's beautiful strong and quite mature as she fights for nobility. Her arsenal of special moves include headbutting an enemy with brute force as she can also unleash upon her enemy a more powerful variation of the butt bomb move known as the super butt bomb as she grabs her enemy as she suplexes her enemy not once but twice, leaps into the air and slams her enemy down onto the ground." Wisdom San said as he introduced the last member of the super duper sumo dogs.

"And I forgot to mention that at anytime they're up against an enemy or group of enemies our four heroes can become considerably larger muscular and more stronger as well by saying in unison it's time to sumo size." Wisdom San explained.

Now what will happen next?
1133.title: Meet a mysterious person/creature

choices: It all begins with a dream
It all begins with a dream
122.content: What's your adventure for the day?

1221.content:
It began like any other school day.

Since my dad died, I had been pretty much looking out for myself, at least in the mornings. Mom was a scientist, and worked most mornings from her basement lab. So I got used to waking myself up, getting myself dressed, and fixing my own breakfast. On school days, though, that was when the solitude ended, because Becky would come over, and we would walk to the bus stop together.

There was one big, but simple, rule in the house: Stay out of the basement. Mom didn't care what it was: if it was in the basement, I was supposed to tell her about it, and she would take care of it.

This was a fine rule when it was an inanimate object that was down there, but today was different. Today, our pet cat, Schrodinger, decided that he wanted to go down to the basement. I didn't want to listen to Mom complaining about cat hair all over the lab for weeks, so I went after Schrodinger.

I found him inside a cabinet, which was empty except for a flower pot. Imagining Mom going on and on about dirt all over her cabinet (when Mom wasn't doing science, she was complaining about something), I scooped up that naughty cat.

Before I could reprimand Schrodinger, however, the cabinet door closed.

That's when I noticed that, unlike other cabinets, the doors to this one were solid, not glass. I wondered: Was that to keep something from getting in, or out?

A moment later, I got my answer, as a weird green light came on over my head.
1221.title: Normal school day

12211.content:
At first, I didn't think anything was happening. I felt fine, and Schrodinger wasn't acting like he was uncomfortable. Why was Mom putting a common houseplant under this green light?

Then I looked up, and I noticed that the light was getting farther away from me. And that the interior of the cabinet was becoming more spacious with each passing second...

That's when I put two and two together: This cabinet was a shrinking chamber. Mom was shrinking the plant. And, since Schrodinger and I were dumb enough to walk into the thing,...

"How small are we going to get?" I asked nobody in particular, and winced at how high-pitched my voice had become. "I'm going to sound like a chipmunk before this is over."

Finally, the green light was turned off, and the cavernous cabinet was plunged into darkness. "Now to wait for Mom to open this thing," I squeaked.

The door opened, and my monument of a mother looked down. "Katie?" her voice boomed.

She dropped to her knees, and the ground shook. "Are you alright?"

"Kinda," I shouted up at her. "I'm not sick, or hurt. But it looks like I'm down to six inches tall."

"What were you doing down here? I've told you never to come down into the basement, and this is why!"

"I was following Schrodinger," I explained. "I didn't want him to mess up whatever you were working on. So, now that we've been shrunk, is there a cabinet to make us big again?"

Mom sadly shook her head. "Not yet, I'm afraid."

"What'll I do now?"
12211.title: I've Been Shrunk!

122112.content:
"For one thing, you are not leaving this basement until I can make some way to restore you and Schrodinger to normal height." Serious, mom said. "I'll make a place for you two to live until then."

"What about school?" Nervous, I called back.

"I'll call you in sick." Calmly, mom replied. "School is not a safe place in your current condition and I need someone to keep the cat out of trouble."

"What do you do down here anyway?" Curious, I asked. "now that the cat is out of the bag, so to speak."

Schrodinger meowed loudly but did not struggle, causing mom to sigh. "I really can't tell you anything right now." Serious, she replied. "Just know that you will learn all of this when the time is right." She sighed. "Mom told me there would be days like this..."

"Grandma...?" Curious, I asked.

Mom ignored me for the moment, moving to a machine on a nearby bench that looked like a 3D printer and typed in a number of keys. she then stepped aside as a beam shot from the machine and a large dollhouse materialized onto an empty table on the other side of the room. "That was incredible!" Amazed, I said.

"It's basic." Lightly, mom said.

She then picked me up with Schrodinger still in my arms and placed us both inside the dollhouse. Immediately, after, she closed the two halves, sealing us inside! Startled, I ran to the front door and threw it open to find mom's huge face. "You will find everything yo need inside." Sternly, she said. "You are not to leave that house until i instruct you, is that crystal clear?!"

"Yes, mom..." Downhearted, I said.

Mom's face softened. "Look, I don't like this either." More calmly, she said. "I'm likely going to get the lecture of a lifetime from your grandmother for leaving the basement door open for Schrodinger to sneak in." The cat meowed again, bring back mom's stern look. "I don't want to hear it, young lady... you are the one who lured Kate into the basement in the first place."

I put Schrodinger down and she walked away with her tail in the air, causing mom to sigh before turning to me. "Please hurry and find a way to return me to normal." Wincing, I pleaded.

"It's not anything I can rush, dear." Sighing, mom said. "Just sit tight and I will tell you when it's safe to come out."

I nodded then slowly closed the front door...
122112.title: I Stay Home

1221121.content:
With nothing else to do, I put Schrodinger down and decided to look over this dollhouse that would be my home for the foreseeable future. At first glance, it looked a lot like the house upstairs. "No basement," I said. "So at least I don't have to worry about what I'd find down there."

In the kitchen, I found all the dishes and flatware I could possibly need, and a generous supply of dry goods. When I opened the refrigerator, I was surprised to find it running, as well as stocked. I took out a bottle of water and sampled it: it was water. "At least I don't have to worry about what I'll have for lunch."

Up the stairs of the dollhouse, I found a spacious bedroom that came complete with a working bathroom. "It's almost enough that I could forget I'm just 6 inches tall. Almost."

Back down the stairs, I opened a tin of cat food and fed Schrodinger. After a few mouthfuls, she looked up at me and meowed.

"Don't give me that," I told her. "You're the reason we're in this mess. If you had stayed out of the basement, I wouldn't have come looking for you. Then we wouldn't have been in the shrinking cabinet. And then we wouldn't be asking ourselves what we'll do if we're stuck this way."

Okay, we weren't both thinking about what would happen if Mom couldn't restore us to our full height, but I certainly was. And I didn't have any answers.

I curled up on the couch and cried.
1221121.title: Exploring the doll house.

choices: I get a phone call from grandma.
12211211.content:
I had eventually cried myself to sleep. I do not know how long I was asleep but I was awakened by grandma's voice as she screeched, "Are you insane?!"

I jumped and ran to one of the front windows to find mom pouting before a rather furious looking grandmother. "The door was closed and locked." Defensively, mom said. "All I can surmise is that Schrodinger somehow learned to open the door."

"That alone is disturbing." Frowning, grandma said. "It still does not excuse you for your lack of diligence... There are multiple safeguards you could have implemented as you know as well as I that Kate has the gift."

"Mother, please..." Whispering, mom pleaded. "She could be listening to this..."

"Let her." Softly, grandma said. "Although she is not completely innocent in this case, your omission of what she might find down here led her to be less cautious."

"I need to find a way to restore her to normal size." Firmly, mom said. "Are you going to help me or lecture me?"

"Careful, young lady." Sternly, grandma scolded. "You are far from an expert in this craft... there are many tricks I can still teach you." She grinned. "I advise you not to learn the hard way."

Mom sighed. "Is there a way to restore them?"

"Of course there is, my dear." Smiling like a python to a rat, grandma replied. "However, I find this to be the perfect opportunity."

"For what?" Wincing, mom demanded.

"For your final test, of course." Grinning, grandma said. "This minor issue should not be an issue at all... if you properly studied." She leaned forward, grinning more. "You have been properly studying, haven't you...?"

"Of- Of course, I have." Looking insulted, mom said.

Grandma smiled then turned to the dollhouse. I jumped seeing her looking at me through the window. "Fear not, my little cherub." Cooing, she said. "If your mother fails to restore you within a week, I will do it for her and begin your training."

She then turned to mom, still grinning. "This is now also a contest, dear daughter." Bemused, she said. "The prize is the right to train your daughter." She let out a soft giggle that sent chills down my spine as she left.

I don't like this, Schrodinger." shuddering, I said.

The can gave a meow that almost sounded like an apology and began to rub herself against my leg, purring...
12211211.title: Mom Talks with Grandma

122112111.content:
I made a sandwich, so at least I wouldn't have to be six inches tall on an empty stomach. Washing it down with a glass of milk, I found that my situation no longer seemed so hopeless. After all, Mom had figured out how to shrink matter: surely enlarging it again wouldn't be too difficult.

The strong smell of coffee outside my little house got my attention, so I returned to the window. Mom was going through a bunch of science books, looking the way I felt the night before a big test.

About the time when either she or I would normally have started working on supper, Mom buried her head in her hands and cried.

I dared her wrath by opening the door and stepping outside the dollhouse. "How's it going?"

"It's no use," she said. "I can't figure this out. I can't restore your size. Your grandmother is going to show me up and put you back, and then she'll start training you, and I'll never see you again."

That did sound like a reason to break down and cry. I almost joined her, until my stomach grumbled, prompting a memory. "How long has it been since you've eaten?"

She lifted her head. "What?"

"I was feeling down this morning. But, after I had some lunch, it didn't seem so hopeless to be in this position. Why don't you fix yourself supper, and look at this again? If nothing else, taking a break might give you a fresh set of eyes to look at things."

My logic seemed to make an impression. Mom wiped the tears from her eyes, then went upstairs.

I went back inside the dollhouse and fixed my own supper.

Mom came back down with a plate of food. I took my own supper, and the two of us ate together, as if I were 5', 6" again. "How'd you get started, doing things like this?" I asked.

"I snuck into my mother's basement laboratory," she said. "I was a couple years younger than you are, with a boundless curiosity."

"So, not like me."

"Don't sell yourself short, Katie. If you hadn't been curious, Schrodinger couldn't have prompted you to come down here. That's the gift, you know: an inquiring mind."

"What happened when you snuck down? I'm guessing you weren't shrunken."

"No, my mother wasn't working on that. No, what I wound up doing was to change my sex."

I stifled a giggle, picturing my mother as a boy. "How long did it take Grandma to change you back?"

A wry smile formed on Mom's lips. "Who said she changed me back?"
122112111.title: Mom hits the books.

choices: You still need to learn a lesson.
1221121111.content:
"Then... she failed too." Thoughtful, I said.

Mom turned to me, curious. "What are you saying...?"

"She couldn't restore you and I'm guessing that by the time she learned how, it was too late as you had adjusted to being a girl." Serious, I explained. "Maybe she is trying to get you not to repeat her mistake by pushing you."

"I haven't thought of it that way." pondering, she muttered. "What do you suggest?"

After a thought, I asked, "Well, how did you get things to shrink?"

"It's done by compressing molecules." Calmly, mom replied. "I found that a certain combination of mild radiation types, rotated in duration and intensity causes this phenomenon to occur safely."

"So... will this process done in reverse have the reverse effect?" Hopeful, I asked.

"I can try with the plant but I do not guarantee success." Sighing, mom said.

"It's worth a shot." Shrugging, I said.

Mom bit her lip, uncertain then turned to her computer. After typing in a few command codes, she placed the tiny plant into the cabinet with a pair of tweezers then closed the door. "Cross your fingers, Kate." Wincing, she said.

I crossed my fingers, hoping for success as mom hit the enter key. I heard the cabinet hum for a few moments then fall silent. Once done, mom sighed then opened the cabinet to find that the plant was restored to normal. Seeing it, I cheered and hugged Schrodinger who gave a meow. "You did it, mom!" Happily, I cheered. "You can restore us!"

"Not so fast..." Firmly, mom said. "Although I did succeed with the plant..."
1221121111.title: Back to Work

12211211111.content:
"I want to be sure," Mom said. "Let me run one more test."

She produced a cage with a hamster in it, and put the cage in the cabinet. Mom pushed a few buttons, then she opened the cabinet, to reveal that the cage and hamster had shrunk, just as Schrodinger and I had. Closing the cabinet again, she reversed the steps. The result: cage and hamster were of normal size again.

"Good enough?" I asked.

Mom nodded. "Good enough. Who should I restore first?"

Schrodinger jumped into the cabinet, and Mom restored her. Putting the now full-size cat upstairs, she placed me in the cabinet, and a red light fell upon me, the source of the light drawing closer as I grew. No more living in a dollhouse for me, I thought.

Finally, the light went out, the door opened, and I threw my arms around Mom. "I knew you could do it, Mom," I said. "You're the... Wait a minute... Weren't we the same height?"

"We were," Mom replied. "Now, you're down from five-six to five-five. Your friends won't notice, but, for you, this will be a reminder not to disobey me again."

"Yikes."

"It may seem harsh, but I have high standards for my assistants."

"But, Mom, a whole inch? Do you really think I wouldn't remember... did you say assistant?"

"I did. You're well old enough, and you'll have to learn the family trade sometime. From now on, if you're not in school or doing homework, you'll be down here helping me. And, if you think losing an inch is a harsh punishment, remember this." She leaned into my face. "You're not my first assistant."
12211211111.title: More tests are required.

122112111111.content:
"Who was your last assistant and what happened to him or her?" Gulping, I asked.

Mom smiled like a python to a rat. "Miss Schrodinger, of course." Calmly, she said. "Well, she was originally a he who foolishly decided to try to out do me in an experiment."

"So you left him, err, her as a cat?" Disturbed, I demanded.

Mom sighed. "Had he tried the experiment under my supervision, she would have simply been restored after a much needed lesson." Serious, she replied "However, due to the fact it was attempted with me out of the lab, I have no way of knowing what she had done and she obviously no longer has the ability to tell me."

"Oh wow." Wincing, I said. "So Schrodinger is her last name..."

Mom nodded. "Exactly... I am hoping you will have a better head on your shoulders and not attempt anything without me present to guide you."

"Okay... where do I start?" Nervous, I asked.

Mom smiled. "We start through book study." Calmly, she replied.

She then led me to her private study in the next room of the laboratory where she sat me down at a small spare desk where I found a literal mountain of books. I threw mom a questioning look only to be given an almost sinister grin. "I want you to read every last page, young lady." Smiling, she said. "Knowledge is the key to power."

"You're joking, right?" Scoffing, I asked. "Isn't there a spell or device that can put all of this into memory in a heart beat?"

Mom giggled. "There is but there is also a device that can erase all of that knowledge just as easily." Amused, she countered. "There are no shortcuts to this form of science. You must learn patience before moving on to the actual studies." She gave me a sinister grin. "Remember your first lesson of impatience..."

With that said, mom quietly left the room. Judging by the grin on her face, I knew she was enjoying this. I turned to the huge stack of books and sighed. Only upon opening the first book, I realized that I had read the entire first page by merely glancing at it and turned to the second only to learn that I had read that just as fast. To my surprise and inner delight, I had read the entire book in less than a minute. What was more surprising was that I could recite the entire book page for page as if I had read it a thousand times. As I moved from book to book, my new speed reading ability became slightly faster and I was able to literally flip through the pages and have the entire book memorized. "This is incredible!" Smiling, I said to yourself. "At this rate, I'll be done in a half hour."

I moved through the books at incredible speed and was done in forty five minutes. As I finished the last book, mom walked in, smiling. "I take it you found that you can speed read now that your gift has awakened." Grinning, she said.

"It was incredible." Smiling, I said. "I didn't need any fancy machine, I just had it in me."

"Many people in this field tend to choose to take the easy way out and use a memory machine and be done with it." Bemused, mom said. "Only the side effects and the ease its benefits can be revered leave much to be desired, leaving them with literally zero training and easily defeated."

I blushed at that. "I'm glad I didn't use the memorization machine." Honestly, I said.

Mom nodded. "I know it is tempting but understand that there are no shortcuts to anything without a price..."
122112111111.title: My New Career

1223.content:
I suppose the first thing you should know about me; I’m kind of a nerd. While most girls my age were obsessed with boys and the latest fashion trends, I was focused on reading the latest science fiction or fantasy novel. That’s not to say I’m not interested in boys, because I am; it’s just, most of the boys I’m interested in are either fictional characters or way out of my league.

It was just after 7:00 in the morning, I was making my way through the park on my way to school. I always cut through the park on the way to school, despite my mom’s warnings about encountering less than pleasant individuals.

I probably should have heeded her warning just this once; because, just as I was about to leave the park, I was approached by what I could only assume was a homeless man. “Hello, little lady.” Smelling of beer, even at this early hour, the man said, “You look like you could use a pick me up.”

Is he offering me some alcohol? “No thank you, sir; I’m only 14.”

“I wasn’t offering you a drink, little lady.” Looking at me, the man said, “On the contrary, I was going to grant you your deepest desire.”

“How would you possibly know what my deepest desire is?”

The man's expression turned serious as he looked at me. “I know more than you think, Claire Douglas.”

I took a step back out of fear. “How do you know my name?”

“Let’s just say that I have certain...abilities.” stepping closer to me, the man said, “All you need to do, is say yes; and your deepest desire will be fulfilled.”

I suppose I should mention at this now; despite being a social outcast at school, I always imagined what it would be like to be popular. But there was no way this man could help me with that. I was running late for school at this point, so I decided to play along with whatever game this man was playing. “Okay fine, fulfill my deepest desire.”

“Excellent; it shall be fulfilled by the end of the day.” With a devilish grin, the man said, “I should warn you, there will be a price to pay.”

I’d already started walking towards the park gate by that point. Without even turning around, I yelled back, “Okay, whatever you say.”

When I got to school a few minutes later, the bell had just rung. Had I not been in a hurry, I would’ve noticed something different about my reflection in the mirror – my frizzy brown hair was becoming straightened and blonde.
1223.title: My Deepest Desire

12231.content:
I walked into my first-period class, History, about 5 minutes after class had started. The whole class looked at me as I walked in, but returned to their notes. However, the teacher, a middle-aged named Mr. Johnson, turned to look at me. “I’m glad you decided to join us, Ms. Douglas.” With a stern look on his face, he said, “This is the third time you’ve been late this week; one more and you’ll get detention.”

I was confused; I’d never been late before in my life, let alone three times in the same week. Everyone was looking at me again, so I sullenly walked towards my desk. “Sorry Mr. Johnson, it won’t happen again.”

While Mr. Johnson went back to talking about the American Revolution, I took my notebook out and started to take notes. But as the class progressed, I found myself becoming more and more disinterested in the discussion. God, this is so boring. Why should I care about any of this.

I looked up for a moment, wondering where that thought had come from. As I went back to taking notes, I noticed something peculiar. Upon closer inspection, I noticed my nails, which had previously been in need of work, were suddenly trimmed and manicured. “What the hell?”

“Ms. Douglas!” turning around, Mr. Johnson said, “How many times have I asked you not to interrupt my class?”

Something strange was going on here, and I needed to figure out what it was. Raising my hand, I said, “Mr. Johnson, I have to use the bathroom.”

“Please make it quick, Ms. Douglas.”

Grabbing my purse, I left the classroom and hurried down the hall to the girl’s room. Running inside, I placed my stuff on the nearest sink and looked at myself in the mirror. What I saw proved, without a doubt, that something was happening to me. Instead of my usual frizzy brown hair and pasty complexion, I saw a girl with nearly perfect skin and blonde hair staring back at me.
12231.title: Strange Occurances

122311.content:
I stared at my reflection in the mirror in disbelief; there was no possible way it was real. A person’s hair doesn’t suddenly just change like this. And then there my nails; and why they were suddenly manicured. The only possible explanation I could think of was that I was dreaming; which, if that was the case, would make this one of my most vivid dreams yet.

I did everything I could to wake myself up, but nothing worked. “Okay Claire, this isn’t a dream.” Looking at myself in the mirror, I said, “Maybe you’re just going crazy and this is all a hallucination.”

As if things couldn’t get any worse, the bathroom door opened at that exact moment; and three members of the cheer squad walked in. Oh God, what now.

I wished that I was suddenly invisible as one of the girls came up to the sink; touching up her makeup. Her name was Brianna Decker, and she liked to make my life hell. So, you can imagine my surprise when she looked at me and said, “Hey Claire, I love that top. Is it new?”

Looking down, I saw that the faded D&D shirt I’d been wearing had been replaced with a rather revealing orange top. I wanted to say that I had no idea where it came from; but instead, I looked at Brianna said, “Yeah, I just bought it this weekend.”

“Well, it looks great on you, girl.” Checking her phone, she said, “I should probably get back to class; I’ll see you in gym class.”

If Brianna and the others could tell I was freaking out, they didn’t say anything. Looking at her, a forced smile on my face, I said, “Sounds great!”

I stayed in the bathroom for a few minutes after Brianna and the others left; trying to process what was happening. After a few minutes, I realized I’d been out of class long enough, so I left and walked back. Hopefully nothing unusual happens for the rest of the day.
122311.title: What is Happening?

1223111.content:
The rest of the class passed by uneventfully, save for my growing disinterest in the subject matter. My second class of the day was gym; I could only imagine what was going to be in store for me there.

As it turned out, I didn’t have to wait long before I found my answer. I was walking through the halls on the way to the locker room when I suddenly stumbled and fell to the floor. What the hell? Picking myself off the floor, I expected to find that I’d tripped over something someone had dropped; instead, I found that my sneakers and jeans had somehow turned into a pair of knee-high boots and a skirt. I’m going crazy, that’s the only explanation.

Things got weirder as Bobby Collins, the school’s star quarterback, came over. He never gave me the time of day, so you can imagine how surprised I was when he reached down and helped me to my feet. “A beautiful girl like you should be more careful, Claire.”

I was suddenly overwhelmed by strange feelings; as I found myself unable to look away from Bobby. I’ve always been into guys, but they never paid any attention to me. So to have one of the hottest boys in school say I was beautiful; well, that was something I hadn’t expected. “Thanks, Bobby, I’ll be more careful.”

**************************


After changing into my gym clothes, I walked out to the gym just as the teacher was starting to call attendance. I was going to take my usual seat at the bottom of the bleachers, but I saw Brianna waving at me and I was suddenly compelled to sit with her up top.

As I took my seat next to her, she said, “Long time no see, girl.” Smiling, she said, “I heard you had a run-in with Bobby Collins in the hall.”

“Yeah, I tripped and he helped me up.” Looking at her, I said, “He is so cute.”

Before I could even question why I was suddenly talking like some boy-crazed teenage girl, Brianna pointed towards the door to the girl’s locker room. “God, here comes the Queen of the Nerds.”

I turned to look where she was pointing and I saw a girl standing just inside the door. She looked familiar, but I couldn’t quite place her; she was wearing glasses and her hair was a mess. I was still trying to figure out who she was when the teacher said,
“Please take a seat, Ms. Hawkins; class is about to begin.”

My jaw dropped to the floor as the girl slowly walked towards the bleachers and took a seat. It couldn’t possibly be true, but it was – that girl was Amy Hawkins; my former best friend.
1223111.title: Gym Class

12231111.content:
Today turned out to be the physical fitness test; so the teacher had to pair us up with our fellow students. I got a few confused looks when I volunteered to be Amy’s partner, but I shrugged it off. I don’t know why, but I suspected whatever was happening to the two of us was connected.

I suppose some back-story would be appropriate here; Amy and I had been best friends since we were 3 years old. Then suddenly, halfway through 7th grade, her attitude changed and she wanted nothing to do with me. We drifted apart after that, I got more interested in school; while she became obsessed with her looks.

Once class began, I walked over to where Amy was standing in the corner. As soon as I walked over to her, she looked at me and said, “Look, Claire, I don’t know why you wanted to be my partner; but I’m not in the mood to be bullied right now.”

Whatever was happening seemed to be changing more than our appearances; apparently, it was even changing our pasts. Where Amy had been bullying me for the last year, apparently I was now her bully. “Relax, I’m not going to bully you.” Looking around, making sure the coast was clear, I said, “Have you noticed anything strange since you got to school this morning?”
Amy’s eyes bugged out. “W-What?”

“Like one minute everything seemed normal, then the next it was different?”

Amy quickly realized that I wasn’t messing with her. “Oh my god, yes!” leaning in, Amy said, “I was in my Math class when suddenly I couldn’t see the board at all.”

I guess that explains the glasses. “Something similar has been happening to me; Mr. Johnson lectured me for being late, even though I’ve never been late to class.” Grabbing my hair, I said, “Then I went to the bathroom and discovered that my hair turned blonde.”

“It seems like no else realizes something is wrong.”

Just then the teacher came over and said, “Now isn’t the time for chit chat, ladies; please get to work.”

After apologizing to the teacher, I looked at Amy and said, “We both have study hall 3rd period; meet me in the library.” Sitting down to do some sit-ups, I said, “We’ll try to figure out what is going on here.”
12231111.title: Talking with Amy

122311111.content:
With all the strange things happening today, I suppose I shouldn’t have been surprised when Brianna waved at me from across the lunchroom. I’d just walked out of the food line with my lunch in hand. I wanted to go find somewhere to sit by myself, but something compelled me to go sit with Brianna.

As I got closer, I saw that she was sitting with a small group of people; including Emily Jones, Mackenzie Adams, Brianna’s boyfriend Jeremy, and another guy named Eric. Taking my seat, I was suddenly overcome by the memory of going to the movies with Eric this past weekend. It was only made more confusing by the fact that I also remembered going to a comic book signing this weekend.

I pushed all those thoughts from my mind as Brianna turned her attention to me. “Girl, I think you have some explaining to do.” Looking at me, she said, “Why would you volunteer to be partners with Amy Hawkins?”

I struggled to think of a reasonable explanation; when it suddenly came to me. Before I knew what I was doing, I said, “She’s been tutoring me in Biology, I needed to apologize for skipping our session last weekend.”

Wait a minute? I’m great at biology.

“That must be torture; having to be anywhere near that loser.” Looking behind me, Emily said, “Speak of the devil.”

I turned around to find Amy, rather sheepishly, standing behind me. “H-Hi guys; can I-I join you?”

Scoffing, Mackenzie said, “What makes you think we’d let you sit with us?”

Amy turned her attention to me; obviously in the hopes that I would side with her. I’ll admit that a part of me wanted to, but another part of me felt the same as the others. After a moment, I _____.
122311111.title: Lunchtime

1223111111.content:
I can’t remember a time where I felt this conflicted about something; I wanted to help Amy but I also wanted to torment her. The conflicting desires were enough to give me a headache. After a moment, I finally made a decision. Turning to Amy, I said, “Get out of here, loser; go sit with your kind.”

I got a kick out of the pained look on Amy’s face, as it was clear I hadn’t done what she expected. The part of me that wanted to help her was getting smaller; as it was overpowered by the new me. Looking at me, Amy said, “But Claire, I...”

Before I could stop myself, I stood up and smacked the tray out of Amy’s grasp. “Are you stupid or something? I said get out of here, you loser!”

Everyone in the lunch stopped what they were doing; as Amy stood there covered in the remains of her sloppy joe. I snapped back to reality just long enough to watch her burst into tears and run out of the lunchroom. I was about to go after her when Emily came up next to me, “It’s about time someone put that loser in her place.”

As I went to sit back down, I was approached by one of the lunchroom monitors. “What’s going on here, Ms. Douglas?”

“I was standing up to get some more napkins when Amy walked right into me with her tray.” With a fake smile, I said, “I tried to apologize because it was my fault, but she ran off crying.”

Turning to the others, the monitor said, “Is this true?”

I knew they would back me up, and I suspected the rest of the lunchroom was too frightened to go against me. Sure enough, Brianna said, “It’s true, ma’am, Claire bumped into Amy by accident.”

It was clear that the monitor wasn’t buying the story, but she didn’t do anything about it. “Just be more careful in the future, Ms. Douglas.”
1223111111.title: I Become The Bully

12231111111.content:
The rest of the lunch period went by without much trouble; we were talking about hanging out at the beach this weekend. As lunch ended, I was bringing my tray to the over to the conveyor belt when I suddenly had a faint memory about meeting Amy at the library. I had a feeling she wouldn’t be too happy with me, but I did promise to meet her there.

I was walking through the hallway towards the stairs when I heard footsteps behind me. I turned to find Jeremy walking up to me. I’d experienced weird feelings every time I looked at him during lunch but couldn’t figure out what was going on. Whatever the reason, the feelings were multiplied 100x now that we were alone.

“Hey Claire, are you doing anything this period?”

“I was supposed to go to the library to work on a project, but I might be able to blow that off.” Smiling, I said, “Why do you ask?”

“Oh, I think you know.”

Before I could question him further, Jeremy walked over and kissed me on the lips. Given how he was Brianna’s boyfriend; I was momentarily surprised when I started kissing him back. But then it all came back to me; Jeremy and I had been secretly dating behind Brianna’s back for the last two months.

The two of us kissed for a moment before I broke it off and said, “As much as I want to, I need to work on this project.”

“Oh come on, you’re seriously going to blow me off for some lame project?"
12231111111.title: Continue

122311111111.content:
Had I been in my right mind, I would’ve declined Jeremy’s offer; but I wasn’t, and I didn’t. So that’s how Jeremy and I found ourselves canoodling in a secluded corner of the cafeteria. The whole time we were kissing, I was faced with a nagging feeling that something wasn’t right.

I couldn’t shake a weird feeling that Jeremy and I weren’t supposed to be dating; and no, it wasn’t because of my friendship with Brianna. I didn’t even know why I was friends with that bitch; especially after she stole my 7th-grade boyfriend. No, the weird feeling I had was because I had a vague memory of Jeremy tormenting me all year.

After we took a break from kissing, Jeremy looked at me and said, “I’ve thought it over, babe; and I decided to break up with Brianna.” Kissing me again, Jeremy said, “You’re a much better girlfriend than she ever was. Would you believe she actually refused to have sex with me?”

I was suddenly faced with the memory of going over to Jeremy’s house last weekend, while his parents were out, and having sex with him. Was it risky for me, a 14-year-old girl, to have sex at such a young age? Yeah, of course; but that didn’t stop me. Looking at Jeremy, I said, “Brianna is so uptight; I swear she only thinks about herself.”

“That’s why I love you, babe; you’ve got no problem showing how much you love me.”

I was about to kiss him again when the bell rang; it was time for 4th period. “I suppose we should get to class.” Getting up, I said,
“Will I see you after school, babe?”

“I don’t know; my dad wants me to help him with some housework.” Kissing me again, Jeremy said, “I’ll try to see you this weekend; after I break up with Brianna.”
122311111111.title: Of course not

choices: It started like any normal day
It all begins with a dream
And that's how I learned the truth about my boyfriend
The beginning of the end of life as I knew it.
Umm... I think I just read your mind
1232.content:
"Babe...Babe...Babe!" Corbin yelled while snapping his fingers in front of my face.

"Huh," I responded. "Sorry what did you say."

"You weren't listening to a thing I said were you," he accused.

Actually I wasn't. I got Corbin, my boyfriend of 2 years tickets to some football game. Who was playing I have no clue. I couldn't care less about sports. But Corbin was obsessed. Which is why I had zoned out. For the last 2 weeks all I have heard about is..This is going to be an amazing game. Or this one has this stat. I mean really a girl could only take so much. Luckily the game was tonight. Surely this would be the last I heard about it

"Sorry honey," I soothed while rubbing his arm. "I got lost in my thoughts."

"Thoughts...hah. Admit it you were probably imagining you outfit for tonight or something."

I just smiled and collected out coffee cups to walk them over to the trash. Corbin and I were grabbing coffee before class. Both of us had a light class day. We both attended Sterlite university. In fact that was how we met. Not in class, but on the way. I was lost and Corbin gallantly came to my rescue. Of course he was new as well and had no clue how to get around either. We both ended up lost and late to our class. But it was worth it. I don't know what was up with Corbin lately. He always has had a healthy dose of confidence, which I found attractive. But here lately he has been making jabs at me. Like that all my thoughts would be about clothing. Really! I was a business major who has made the dean's list every year. I was well on my way to scoring a very sought after internship was a multi-million dollar company.

But I knew that Corbin was in a very stress time of his college career. He was probably just stressed. That was one reason I bought him these tickets. I wanted him to have a night out where he could relax.

"Hey I gotta go babe," he said as I came back to our both. "Don't want to be late. I'll see you later for the game." He got up and rushed out the door.

"Yeah I can't wait," I called back.
~~~~~~~~~

"Hey girl," my best friend Moeisha called out after catching up to me after my last class that day.

"Hey"

"Have I told you how jealous I am that you scored tickets to the game."

"Oh no. Not you too. Please don't mention this stupid game. I am starting to wish I never got those tickets. These last two weeks have been torture." I said dramatically.

"Oh yeah," she said exaggeratingly. So tough. Let's see. 1) you have a super hot boyfriend. 2) you are going to the game of the season with said hotty. 3) Not only is your love life amazing, but everyone knows you are going to get the internship with Dreamer Inc. Yep torture."

I sighed. "Nobody knows I'm going to get."

"Uh-huh she said unconvincingly. Well I'm just saying you better take lots of pictures. And I want all the details from the game."

Sure thing.

Little did I know my night was going to be so chaotic there would be no time for pictures. And what a story I would have to tell.
1232.title: Going to a big game

choices: Don't think about her...don't think about her
Ok this has got to be a joke
12323.content:
"Ms. Stevenson," I heard as I was gathering my things to head out of class. I turned around to see Jared Pingleton trying to get my attention. Jared was the assistant professor. Most of the females in my class loved the days when Jared was the lecturer. I could understand why. Jared was an attractive man. He would definitely fall into the tall dark and handsome category with his athletic 6'4 frame, wavy dark locks, and ice-blue eyes. But in my opinion those eyes held secrets. Secrets that gave me the hebi gebis. There was something about the way he looked at you, like he was the top dog. I don't know how else to explain. Something deep in my bones told me to stay away. So unlike the other girls in my class who were giving me the stink eye, I was not pleased to have caught his attention.

"Yes, Mr. Pingleton," he replied as he reached me. "I have told you to call me Jared. Mr. Pingleton makes me sound stuffy," He showed off perfect teeth while giving me a devastatingly handsome smile. I could feel the lingering girls melting into puddles from the sight.

"I just don't feel like that would be appropriate," I politely replied. I did not want him to get the wrong impression.

A look flashed across his face. Now the look could have passed off as disappointed or hurt, but I felt something more. Almost like he just expected me to be putty in his hands. No thank you. I was not going to be one of those girls.

He turned up the charm, "Well I am just going to have to try harder to get you to change your mind."

Not likely I thought. "Did you need something? I am catching a game with my boyfriend and really need to be on my way." Yes I will admit that I might have emphasized the word boyfriend However, that apparently did not stop him.

"Oh that is too bad. I wanted to talk with you about your possible internship with my uncle's company. You know Sterlite Inc."

He threw it out casually, but I could totally tell he was name dropping. I just stared at him.

"I mean I know that it is a sought after position. I am more than willing to give you some.....suggestions to give you a edge over your competition.

Uh-uh, I thought. I just bet he had suggestions. "I appreciate it, but like I said I really need to go because I already have plans." With that I began to once again walk away.

"But wait!" he said with a mix of disbelief and frustration. "What about the internship?"

"I appreciate the offer, but if I can't get the internship on my own, then it was just not meant to be." I had made it to the door and thought I had made my escape when he grabbed my arm. I jerked around, and saw barely contained anger in his eyes.

"Well, that is a noble ideal. It seems like you would be an excellent addition to our team. Here take one our Sterlite bars as an offer of good will towards your future success.

"Thanks," I shakily said. By the end the anger had receded from his eyes. He was back to his normally charming self. I almost had myself convinced that I imagined the anger. I took the snack bar and quickly left the room. When I looked over my shoulder, he was still at the door. Standing and staring with an oddly satisfied look on his face. I shivered and picked up my speed. I just wanted to get this encounter over with.
~~~~~~~~~~
"I am so excited babe," Corbin gushed. "This is going to be epic."

"Yeah" I said mustering as much enthusiasm as I could. It didn't matter though because Corbin was not paying me any attention. He was so focused on the game that he wasn't listening to me. I had tried to tell him about my weird encounter earlier. He didn't seem the think it was a big deal.

"You are just being paranoid. He wasn't coming on to you. I mean really the dude is set for life. His uncle is loaded, and I'm sure he will get a part of that. There is no way he is choosing to go after you."

I have to admit after all this was said, I was a little heated. I mean who could blame me. Maybe he didn't mean it the way it came out but it sounded pretty bad. I wanted to rant and rave and raise cane, but what good would it do? As angry and hurt as I was, I would probably only say things I didn't mean which I couldn't take back. I will admit Corbin was acting kinda jerkish here lately, but that was not the Corbin I had fallen hard for. At the beginning of the relationship he was so thoughtful and romantic. My parents did not have the most healthy relationship during my childhood. They eventually divorced after it came out that my dad was having an affair. He has since been in and out of relationships with a plethora of women. Mom meanwhile played the martyr. Needless to say, I was kinda wary about letting people in to close. But Corbin had been both understanding and patient. He was my friend before my boyfriend. Plus all relationships went through rough patches. We would just need to talk it out once our lives were a little less chaotic.

At that moment, my stomach began to rumble. I realized I had not eaten lunch today. We still had about an hour until we got to the game location. I was not about to ask Corbin to stop and get something. I was still angry. I dug through my bag and pulled out the Sterlite bar. I really wasn't too fond of these things, but I was hungry. I opened the wrapper and took a bite. I had to admit it tasted pretty good. It was different from the other ones I had tried. Maybe it was a new flavor.
~~~~~
By the time we pulled up to the gate, it was packed. I really wasn't too fond of crowds but I could manage for a while. Corbin found a place to park and then came over to help me out of the car. A little of my anger faded away. He could be a gentleman. We would work things out.

Man, oh man, I love this atmosphere. I wonder where are seats are? I heard Corbin say.

I quickly told him how to get to our seats. He gave me a strange look, but nevertheless we headed towards our seats. Now the journey took longer because Corbin was constantly stopping to talk to someone. I was used to this however. He was a true people person. Only some of the things he said did not match up to the reactions from the people. Like when he called an acquaintance I cheapsake for not paying back some owed money, the guy just smiled and high-fived him. Boys were weird.

We made it to our seats and I heard Corbin say, Man I wish I would have grabbed a Dr. Pepper.

"That's odd," I said. Corbin was a die-hard Sprite fan. If not Sprite then water or gatorade. He rarely drank anything else.

"What is odd?" he asked.

"You wanting Dr. Pepper," I said nonchalantly. "You normally want...."

"How did you know I wanted Dr. Pepper?" he asked puzzled.

I rolled my eyes as I replied, "Because you just said it." I got up to go get a Dr. Pepper.

I didn't say that out loud did I. I must have. That's crazy. I bet she is going to get me a Dr. Pepper. I should probably offer her to go but I really don't want to miss a second of this. Oh well she won't mind. She would probably insist. She always does.

I stared at him for a while in confusion. Why was he rambling like that. And then I noticed something. His lips weren't moving. If his lips were not moving what was I hearing. I dropped back down to my seat.

Oh I guess she changed her mind. Oh well those people who are walking up and down the isles selling snacks should be coming through soon. I just hope I'm not so focused on the game that I miss them. I can't believe I am here. This is...why is she looking at me like that. "Babe?" Corbin said with a raised brow.

"Umm..." I stammered. "I think I just read your mind."

I immediately heard a series of explicatives. Which surprised me. Corbin knew how I felt about cussing and normally didn't curse around me. Is she kidding?

"No I'm not kidding. And man that's quite some language."

His eyes widened. Then I heard him think....
12323.title: Umm... I think I just read your mind

123233.content:
He busted out laughing. And I do literally mean busted. I just watched in shocked as his face turned red and he was doubled over rocking back and forth.

I crossed my arms over my chest.

"I mean babe. That was a good one. I don't know how you did it but you got me good." he said while wiping tears out of his eyes. Read my mind. Yeah right. If she could read my mind she would not be sitting here calmly after....

Suddenly my head started aching something fierce. I had to close my eyes to fight against the pounding. The roaring crowd was too loud and the sunlight was killer.

"Now babe, don't be embarrassed that I found out your trick. You will just have to try harder next time," Corbin stated while gently patting me on the back. Really! Did he even know me?

My hands began to shake and my eyes watered. I couldn't think about Corbin right now. I had to do something about this excruciating pain. I grabbed my bag and got up.

"Dani?" Corbin called. Maybe he did feel some remorse. You don't have to get me a Dr. Pepper. I really think the game is about to start."

I sped away. If my head wasn't splitting open I probably would have him a thing or two. But there was no time for that. I needed to get to a quiet, dark place. Then I could check my purse for some aspirin. Maybe a wet cloth would help to. I decide to make my way to the bathroom. Today must have been my luck day because there was no line. I went in and proceeded to wet a paper towel. By this point the pain had started to dull a little. Maybe it would go away on its own.

I heard the door open. A few girls walked in. I had classes with a couple of them. All of a sudden my mind felt like it was on fire again. This time I was weak with the pain. I made my way out of the bathroom and barely had the energy to plop down on a bench. I placed my head in lap and just rocked back and forth. I couldn't even manage to put the wet towel up to my head.

I felt gentle hands on my back. "Hey there, are you okay?" The words were just as gentle and soothing as the hands. I am normally not a touchy-feely person. But right now I was not going to complain. My pain was easing just a little. Enough that I was able to raise up and look at my rescuer. Who was it?
123233.title: Ok this has got to be a joke

choices: That imbecile! I knew he would cause trouble eventually
I think I know what is wrong with you
This place is too loud. Would you like me to take you somewhere quieter?
1232333.content:
I looked up to see Professor Kawalski.

"Hey there. Are you okay?" she said while continuing to rub soft small circles into my back. Professor Kawalski was a conundrum. She looked very unassuming. Her clothes were always conservative but stylish. It was almost like she did not want to draw attention to herself. Then there was the fact that not only was she a noted professor at Sterlite University, she was also on the board of adviser for Sterlite Inc. She wasn't family either.

Sterlite Inc was one of the oldest companies in Georgia. It started out as a small manufacturing company, but has since then continued to expand. Looking at this companies history is fascinating. Okay maybe only to a business geek like me but whatever. Somehow Sterlite Inc always managed to start a new venture before it gets big. In other words everybody wanted to be a part of this company. However, understandably, it was very picky with its hires. Most of the employers were family.

Professor Kawalski was not family however, and yet she was able to get a coveted position. And despite all this was able to come across as real and normal. Not some business suit wearing, power-walking, no time for anyone executive. She was down-to-earth. Now don't get me wrong, she was no pushover. And her classes, I have been on her roster every chance I could, were some of the most challenging, yet beneficial I have ever been apart of. I'll admit she was kind of my hero.

I was shocked to find her here at a game. "I'm ok. I just got a migraine all of a sudden. I think I have some medicine in my purse," I said weakly. While my pain had lessened some, moving was still not a good idea.

"Do you mind?" she asked while motioning to my purse.

I nodded. Which was a bad idea.

She began to search my purse for the medicine when I heard a gasp.

"Where did you get this?" she asked

I looked over and noticed she had the wrapper of the bar that Jared gave me. "Mr. Pingleton gave it to me after class." Maybe the pain was getting to me but I thought I saw fire flash in her eyes.

Next thing I knew, I heard her say.....
1232333.title: Professor from school

choices: Why can't I remember what is going on?
12323331.content:
That imbecile! I knew he would cause trouble eventually! I wonder how he plans to explain this one away.

The whole time she was ranting, she had a calming smile on her face. That was odd I thought. And who was the imbecile? Jared? What did he have to do with this? And what is this. All of a sudden the pain came back in full force. I cried out in pain and doubled back over. This time I felt myself slowly fading away.
~~~~~

Next thing I knew, I woke up in a room that was not mine. My head still felt a little fuzzy. I slowly turned my head to get a better look at the room. I was afraid the movement would bring back the pain, but it didn't. Thank goodness. I found myself in a very elegantly decorated room. The colors were bold and the bed felt amazing. Now I should probably be worried about why I was in a strange bed, but I couldn't bring myself to care. Until I heard the door open anyway.

"Oh good you are awake," I heard a complete stranger utter. At this point I begin to become a little..or a lot nervous. I desperately tried to think back to the last thing I remembered. The problem was my brain was not cooperating. It was almost like I couldn't think. At least not about anything that mattered.

"Now, now. Don't worry," the stranger said. "You are not in any trouble and are safe. Actually there are a lot of people who would want to be in your position. In fact many would see this as an honor." The stranger continued to ramble about honor and destiny. What was going on and why couldn't I remember no matter how hard I tried.

"Oswald," a familiar voice admonished. "I told you not to disturb our guest."

"No ma'am I wasn't disturbing her. I was trying to comfort her and reassure her. You see when I came in to check on her, quietly I promise, she was awake. She seemed to be rather bothered. I knew you didn't want her upset so I began telling her about what a honor she is being bestowed upon her."

"Oswald, Oswald," the woman's voice interjected. "I know you were trying to help, but I believe you are overwhelming her.

Oswald froze and looked at me. "I'm so sorry miss. I didn't mean to. I was just trying to.." his voice broke off. The poor man looked positively devastated. I was feeling bad for him, and I was the one in a compromising situation.

"Its not your fault," I said. "I'm just a little confused."

"Oswald why don't you go get her some water. I"m sure that would make her feel better."

Oswald's face immediately lifted and he practically ran out the room. "You will have to excuse him. He can be a little over the top, but he means well and has a heart of gold."

I just weakly smiled. I knew that her voice and face were familiar but once again, I just couldn't bring the information into fruition.

"You must have a million questions? I promise to answer them all. I just need you remain calm and listen to everything we have to say."

"We?" I inquired.

"Oh yes. I have informed Josh Sterlite that you were rousing. He should be here any minute. But let's go ahead and start what would you like to know first?
12323331.title: That imbecile! I knew he would cause trouble ev...

123233311.content:
"Who are you?" I queried. It was seriously nagging at me that I didn't know her name when she seemed so familiar,

Her eyebrows raised and her eyes widened. "That's your first question? I wasn't expecting that." she said while studying me curiously.

In a lot of ways she was correct. I had some many questions that I could ask, but this seemed to be the most pressing one. I could make up an answer, or play dumb. I watched her watching me. I decided to be honest. "Look I don't know what is going on here. In fact I don't know a lot of things. And you are right I have a lot of questions to ask, but I feel like I should know you. Now I am not getting a bad vibe. But I would like to know where we stand before I synthesize the information you give me." Maybe I was making a mistake playing all my cards, but lets be real I don't have many high value cards from the get-go.

"I have always said that you are one of the brightest pupils I have had the privilege of teaching."

Pupils? Teaching? Was she one of my school teachers? That felt close to being right but not quite.

"I am Natasha Kawalski. You know me as Professor Kawalski. Look, I know this must be frustrating but don't try to think too hard. The medicine we gave you should start wearing off shortly. Until it does you won't be able to remember."

"Medicine? What did y'all give me?" I could feel my heart start racing.

"Relax, relax. We had no choice. It was the only way to stop the pain long enough for us talk. And we have a lot to talk about. So what is your next question?"
123233311.title: Who are you?

1232333111.content:
I stopped trying to remember my past, and instead thought about what I knew. I was having unexplained pain, they were giving me medicine. Medicine that wasn't fixing the problem, but just treating the pain. She was being very nurturing and comforting. The Oswald character was nervously trying to make me see the bright side. I could only come to one conclusion.

"Am I dying?" I tried my best to keep the quiver out of my voice. If this was the truth, I was going to face it with difficulty.

"Dying? Why would you...." her voice drifted off as if she was trying to fit the pieces of the puzzle together. "You are not dying. Not by a long shot."

"Then what is going on? Why do I need medicine to control the pain. As far as I can tell, I don't have any life altering injuries." I paused to take stock of my body. Was I paralyzed? No I could feel and move my body.

"Okay I was going to try and ease you into this, but it seems like you just want the facts straight. So here goes. I am sure you are aware of Dreamer Inc and Sterlite Inc. Most people who do their research know that these two companies are really related. They are both ran by the same family. The founding family of Sterliteville. Both companies are extremely successful, but not many people know all of the companies ventures. Now since you have applied for an internship with Dreamer Inc, I'm sure you have thoroughly researched both companies, but even you would not have picked up on some of our.....less known endeavors."

I applied for an internship. That sounded right but my mind was still blank. This was not making sense. My head was starting to feel fuzzier. I brought my hands up to my temples to begin rubbing circles. I needed to pay attention. But it was hard to pay attention when I was being given information that I was having trouble processing.

"Of course you still can't remember any of this, so that makes all this information not very useful. Ugh! I can't believe Jared put us all in the situation. Ok actually I can, I knew giving him more responsibility would not end well. Sometimes I hate being right. But thats beside the point. Right now me explaining things isn't going to make a whole lot of since.

Just when I thought I was going to have a serious breakdown with all the nonsensically information the door opened....
1232333111.title: Am I dying?

choices: What do you know about us?
12323331113.content:
I figured it would be Oswald bringing a glass of water. I really wasn't thirsty, but having a glass of water would be a timely distraction. However, it wasn't Oswald who opened the door. It was a kindly looking older man. He was bald on the tops with thick, curly gray hair surrounding the lower parts of his head. He was dressed very distinguishable in sable colored suit. I didn't know this man, but just his presence seemed to put me at ease.

"Oh well hello there. I am so glad you are awake," he said as he approached me. He had a booming voice for a little old man. "Of course I guess I am the one to blame for putting you to sleep. But it couldn't be helped."

"Should I know you too?" honestly by this point all the fight had left me. I was tired of being confused. I just wanted to curl up in a ball and cry and cry, and keep on crying until my world made sense again.

His jovial gray eyes seemed to soften. "No my dear we have never met. But I'm guessing you don't remember that. I'm sure the last several hours have not been pleasant for you."

"I'm not sure about the last few hours, but the last few minutes definitely not. I just want answers."

"I thought Natasha was going to explain things to you?"

"I was," Natasha interjected, "but we had a bit of a problem. Everytime I mentioned something, she would try to remember the significance. She of course can't remember which would further distress her."

"Ah yes, I should of thought of that. Oh bother! Where was my brain at." He seemed to be generally upset with himself.

"Oh I don't know," Natasha said tongue-in-cheek, "maybe hmm overseeing you multi-million dollar companies, and charitable entities. This wasn't exactly scheduled in your calendar."

"I know you are trying to make me feel better, but I have people are perfectly capable of handling the day to day running of my company. Not many can truly fix this situation."

"True...2 others to be exact. 1 of which got us into this mess and the other well....he probably would not have treated it with your level of tact"

Surprise, surprise I had no clue what they were talking about, but it seemed like they were both busy people with way more important things to do than hang around my bed comforting me. "I'm sorry I am such a burden. If you have other things to do....well I can wait or whatever" I mean really I wanted answers now, but I was used to not getting what I wanted and fending for myself. At least I think I was?

"Nonsense, nonsense you are not a burden," Natasha said while giving the gentleman a pointed look. "We just find ourselves in a new situation and are trying to determine the best way to proceed."

The man didn't say anything for a long time. He just continued to stare at Natasha. Not in a creepy way of anything. It was almost like he was trying to communicate something to her.

It was started to get a little uncomfortable. Like they were trying to keep me out of the loop. Not that they needed to try too hard. I couldn't even find the loop. "Well you don't have to go out of your way on my account. You said the meds would wear off soon, so I should be getting my memories back. I'm sure at that point I will be able to take care of....whatever is going on. And as long as I"m not dying I'm sure I can figure something out.

"That is a very brave offer considering the situation in which you find yourself in. However, it is not necessary. And frankly implausible. I'm afraid what you are experiencing is not like anything you have dealt with before. But don't worry...its not bad...just different. But that is enough of these vague words. Let's cut to the chase. It seems you have found yourself in the middle of some family secrets. Now I am going to do something about the mental block that was put on you. As soon as do so you might begin to feel some discomfort as your memories begin to flood back in. Normally I would say this would go away very quickly but due to some.....other circumstances it will probably lead to some serious pain. I can help, or rather give you the resources and knowledge to overcome that problem but first you have to get your memories."

I just stared at the man. He really wasn't making a whole lot of sense. I got the impression he knew he wasn't but needed to get through the information. He really did seem to be a little out-there, but my gut was telling me to trust him.

"So once you think you have your memories, then I can begin to ease the pain and work on a solution. All you have to do is take my hand to let me know you are ready?

I tentatively took his hand. As soon as I did, it was like my mind became flooded with information. I saw my parents, birthday parties (or lack of), school event. My friend, boyfriends. I knew Natasha Kawalski (my low key hero). Once I had time to really process this, I would be freaking out that she saw me in this state. I also recognized Joshua Sterlite. THE JOSHUA STERLITE. I was definitely going to have a geek out later. It would have to be later though because I also remembered my altercation with Jared and going to the game with Corbin. Then I remembered feeling like I read his mind, and going to the bathroom and....then nothing because the pain was back in spades. I felt like my head was going to explode. There was too much inside and it wasn't made to control all of it. Tears were running freely down my flushed face. I couldn't do this. I couldn't take much more of this.

"Joshua I think she has had enough." Professor Kawalski sounded nervous.

"Yes, yes. I just had to be sure or else we will have to repeat this unpleasant process" He put his hand to my forehead and almost immediately the pain disappeared. I sighed and sagged in relief. "Is that better?"

"Yes, thank you" I said weakly. I wish I could say that all my confusion cleared up immediately, but it didn't. Now was puzzled what just happened, and why I was with these 2 people. Where was I? Why was I here? What happened to Corbin?

"Slow down, slow down." I will answer all your questions in time."

Good I thought. Wait a minute I didn't say that out loud...did I?

"No you did not. That is one of the many things we are going to have to talk about. But first.....
12323331113.title: Mr. Sterlite walks in

choices: We made a deal with the earth
We made a deal with the fae
We made a deal with an alien race
123233311131.content:
"But first I am going to have to give you a lesson in our family history. You must understand the information I am going to share with you a closely guarded secret. Normally only members of our bloodlines, and loyal friends are made aware of our secrets."

Secrets I thought. I didn't want to talk about secrets. How about what just happened. This is crazy! Am I dreaming? Surely that had to be it. Otherwise how could he have stopped the searing pain with just a touch to my forehead. And really what was causing the pain? What was happening to me..

"Ms. Danielle I know this is overwhelming and confusing, but I really need you to pay attention." Mr. Sterlite said while patiently trying to get my attention.

I tried to push my panic filled thoughts away. "I'm sorry I will try to ...no I will focus."

"No apologies necessary. As I was saying it is of the utmost importance that you keep the information to yourself. I also realize what I am about to say my seem....preposterous but keep an open mind."

Considering the turn my life has taken in the last few hours I wasn't sure what to believe or not believe.

"So my family is not your average family. Many people attribute our family with the founding of our town. That is mostly true. Our ancestor many many years ago were looking for a place to settle. It seems like we were drawn to this land. Once we...they got here it became apparent why. These lands were hurting."

The lands were hurting? What did that mean?

"Mankind has made many marvelous advancements, but those advancements come with a price. The price was that the earth was hurting it was becoming diseased."

I knew that both Dreamer Inc and Sterlite Inc. were very adamant about being nature conscious. I had no opinions one way or another, but I had done my homework for both companies. I only applied for an internship for Dreamer Inc. but it never hurt to be too prepared.

"You might be wondering what that has to do with what is happening today. Your new abilities are directly related from the deal my family made.
123233311131.title: Family history lesson

1232333111312.content:
"A deal we made with the fae," he continued.

I did a double take. "I'm sorry could you repeat that. I thought you said a deal with the fae."

He gave me a nonchalant smile. "You heard me correctly. What do you know of the fae?"

You mean other than the fact that they are fictional, I thought.

"I assure you they are not quite real. They tend to stay in the shadows however because as history has proven time and time again, people are not always accepting of differences. And honestly I can't blame the fear. Fae can be very powerful creatures. Some of the things I have seen them do...well it could give you nightmares if you think about it being used against you." He shuddered. "Anyways, as I mentioned before as humans became more advanced, the earth became less and less healthy. Most creatures of the fae have a very strong and spiritual connection to the earth. This angered them, and trust me when I say that their ways are not our ways. It had gotten to the point where they were ready to do real damage. "

"Damage?" I know what he was saying made no sense. It sounded like something from a storybook. And really there were lots of parts I could have questioned. I really wasn't even sure if I believe the words I was being told, but I was a huge fangirl. I was in awe of Josh Sterlite's companies, and his achievements. Maybe he was secretly crazy. Maybe he wasn't. Either way I might as well go with it for now.

A smile and an approving look flashed through his eyes. "Yes well...just like people have different personalities and morals so do the fae. Some of the more volatile breeds wanted to wipe out all of humanity. Some thought it would be a good idea to destroy all factories."

I gulped. "What stopped them?"

"One fateful moment. Or at least that is how my family likes to think about it. This event occurred many many years ago. I...I mean on of my ancestors was taking a hike through the woods of his property. We came upon a a woodland nymph. She was the most gorgeous creature you could imagine although otherworldly in appearance. Her skins was a pale green. Ivy leaves crowned her head. But she wasn't moving. She was obviously in distress laid out on a tree stump. Once approached she had fear and despair in her eyes. Like the fight had left her. I turns out she had been injured by a rival force. She had become separated from the rest of her allies. My family gave her shelter and helped her gain her strength. At first she was hesitant. She mentioned the fact that by housing her we would be in danger. That didn't stop my family. Apparently the fae had witnessed other instances of bravery, compassion, and understanding. After lots of talks, from both ends, it was decided that certain human families would be both guards and go-betweens. My family is one of the chosen ones. "

He paused. Not because he was finished, but like he was waiting for my reaction. How was I going to react?
1232333111312.title: We made a deal with the fae

choices: But we are going to let you rest for the day
12323331113122.content:
I wish I could say that I reacted calmly. I took in all the information and relayed any questions I had. That would have been the dignified way to handle this situation. Afterall, I had 2 people whom I admired the most in a room with me. I really, really wanted to make a good impression. But that is not what happened. I bursted out laughing. Not a little laugh either. I guffawed so hard I had tears running down my face and I was having trouble breathing. I noticed Professor Kawalski and Mr. Sterlite were exchanging questioning looks. I'm sure they probably were wondering if I was going crazy. Let's be honest, this whole situation was crazy. Luckily I was saved from trying to relay my feeling by Oswald walking in with a tray.

"What's so funny. Did I miss a joke. I do so love jokes. Will someone tell me the joke." He walked over to the bedside table and laid down his tray. It contained water, some fruit, cheese, crackers, and a Sterlite bar. "I know you just asked for water," he continued not giving anyone a chance to tell him the joke, if there was one, "but then I though you might be hungry. I'm not sure what you like to eat, and I didn't want to bring you too much in case I brought something you didn't like but were felt like you had to eat it because you didn't want to seem rude. So instead I just brought you a snack. But then I didn't know if you wanted something salty or sweet. Or if you were extremely health conscious. If figured these were good options to start out with. But if you don't like it please don't feel like you have to eat it. Or if you are really hungry tell me what you have a taste for and I will bring you some real food."

I was tired just listening to him. He was literally talking a mile a minute.

"Oswald," Professor Kawalski cut in quickly once she had a chance, "I am sure this is absolutely perfect. Why don't you leave this here and go see if Cookie needs any help.

"Yes I will do that." He immediately made his way to the door when he turned back around. "But what about the joke?"

"We will tell you later."

He smiled and left.

By this time, I had gotten my laughter under control. I took a sip of water to give myself some time to think. And to hopefully calm the redness I could feel creeping over my face. Whether what I heard was true or not (and after the day I was having who was I judge) I still wasn't sure what it had to do with me.

"Yes well. When we were elected with this honor, the question of protection was brought up. Originally some of the fae representatives volunteered to guard my family. However, the fae were unprepared for how fertile humans were. Apparently most fae breeds had one pregnancy ever 100 years or so. Then as the children grew up they wanted to go off to college so we had to revise our plan. Without protection, the breeds who deemed mankind as unworthy, could attack my family and delve the world into chaos. So it was decided that my family needed to be powerful enough to defend ourselves. Therefore we were gifted certain abilities."

"Abilities?"

"Yes, we hide the powers from other humans because you can imagine what people would do if they knew about them. The relatives who are share the same blood as the original have more varied and stronger powers which they are born with. However anyone who marries into the family also needs protection, but not necessarily to the same degree. The fae aren't as trusting. Normally they have to be vetted, and are given powers with conditions."

I have to admit. I was kind of caught up in this story. It sounds pretty amazing, and a little daunting. I was trying to figure out, however, how this connected to me. I'm pretty sure I am not related to the Sterlite's and I"m definitely not marrying one. So why would I need to know this. "

"The original way to get these powers included a meeting with a representative fae. We never know which breed we are going to get and trust me a meeting with any other them can be......intense. Now thanks to scientific and technological advancement's my company is experimenting with alternative way to pass on the power. Before I continue I need a little bit of information from you. Can you tell me about your day up until now?"

I was a little taken aback by this question. I mean what did he want me to tell? Where did I even start.

"How about you begin with when you woke up this morning and just tell me what you are comfortable with. If I have any questions I will stop you and ask for more information"

And this was why he was my hero. He was literally answering my questions before I even asked. I began telling him about my day. The normal stuff waking up, getting ready, meeting Corbin.

"Corbin Watkins?" Professor Kawalski asked.

"Yes he is my boyfriend and we had plans to see the big game today..." my voice trailed off and my eyes grew wide. "I was at the game with him. He has got to be worried. Where is my phone"

She handed me my purse. I fumbled through it to find my phone. I looked and saw several missed calls. I opened up my texting app and saw he had texted a few times. At first he was just questioning where I was. Then he turn a little angry. I shot him a quick text telling him I was ok and would call him tomorrow when I checked the time stamps of the text. He did not start asking for me until right about when half time should be. It took him that long to notice my disappearance. Really. I looked up to find both sets of eyes on me. I flinched and quickly put my phone away.

"Anyways after that I went to class. Mr. Pingleton was lecturing today."

"Did you have any interactions with Jared outside of class."

I mentally shuddered thinking about it. I know Corbin thought I was being paranoid, but Jared had really been off. "Yes he wanted to speak to me about my internship with Sterlite Inc."

Mr. Sterlite's eyes lit up. "Oh you applied for an internship with us? Delightful"

"Yes..well no... kinda? I really applied for Dreamer Inc, but while they are both related they are technically different. I would have loved to have an opportunity for Sterlite Inc, but I knew it was likely they wouldn't even except applicants. Therefore I went through Dreamer instead."

"Hmm....is that all with Jared"

I hesitated. I didn't want to mention the fact that it seemed like Jared wanted to talk about things of a more personal nature. Afterall I was talking to his grandfather. He would probably think I was just reading more into it like Corbin did. I notice him start frowning, so I continued on. "Pretty much he just gave me a snack bar in celebration of the possibility of working together."

"Was this bar one of the Sterlite bars?" he asked.

"Yes although it must have been a new flavor because I hadn't tasted it before. But it was delicious." I didn't want to tell him I really didn't like any of the other flavors. "Anyways its a good thing he did. Corbin was so excited to get to the game that he didn't want to stop for food. I ate the bar. Then we arrived at the game."

As soon I mentioned Jared, Professor Kawalski gave Mr. Sterlite a pointed look.

"Did you anything odd after you ate the bar."

"I mean I did start to get a head ache. And...." I had forgotten until this point the moment when I thought I could read Corbin's mind. I thought about whether I should mention it or not, but in the end I might a well. "There was one thing...maybe. I really thing I was reading Corbin's mind. He of course didn't believe me and before I could explore further my headache got worse. I though to cool off for a while, so I went to the restroom to splash water on my face. For a while it eased but when some girls from school came in it got so much more intense. I barely made it to a bench outside when you found me." I addressed the last part to the professor.

"That is what I feared. It seems there is one more side to this story that I need."
12323331113122.title: bust out laughing

info.brief_description: Welcome to Sterliteville. What is our town known for...well that is up to you.
info.description:
This story is exactly what you make it! Let's have fun and allow our creative justice to flow.

Rules: Please try to refrain from using crude language or highly sexual content. Also I am perfectly ok with randomness and silly outcomes, but please make sure if you make a choice your writing fits that choice.
